item.title: Fly tipping in derelicty garages on Council owned land, 7th December
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam, As per the photo, several derelict garages on council owned land in Sewell Road, just to the east of the junction with Grovebury Road, have very recently been fly tipped. Can the fly tipping please be removed & the garages boarded up? Also can the garages be boarded up with metal shuttering that can not be easily removed? As per the photo the fly tippers have only fly tipped in the derelict garages previously boarded up by wooden shuttering. Clearly that must have been easy for the fly tippers to remove. Also can the Greenwich council owned CCTV camera that looked over this area be reinstated? As since it was removed a few weeks ago, there has been a big increase in fly tipping. Kind regards

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ampleforth Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Suspected Abondoned Vehicle, 7th December
item.description:
This vehicle has been outside my house at 30 Oak Grove Road now since the begining on November 2025 and hasn't moved. After checking MOT and Tax on DVLA it seems they have no record of the vehicle. I suspect it has been abandoned. As you can see from the images it has some damage to the side. Please can you look into it, it would be greatly appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Oak Grove Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
